Reviews.Title: “Great - just a shame about the staff”
Reviews.Author: TSM2010
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, great room, great view. Not great value for money though, and everything when you're there is so expensive, especialy when you're factoring in the usual London staff-rudeness! I guess it is where it is... it's not a special place to go to with a loved one but was perfectly adequate for business travel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Kathleen T
Reviews.Content: The location, the size of the rooms, the cleanliness and good facilities and breakfast make this hotel great value for money. The rooms, although slightly dated are good to come back to - I'm not sure why some people expect "The Ritz" for these prices! Would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Aye, it's ok”
Reviews.Author: Richard_Gillis
Reviews.Content: The Lancaster is a decent enough hotel for London. It's rooms are large but overall could do with an overhall (very squeeky floorboards, small tv, limited plugs etc). The bathroom had clearly just been done up however, which was pretty nice. Breakfast was pretty standard, and the service was good and attentive. Overall a decent enough hotel at a good rate. No wifi or web connection.

Reviews.Title: “Retro-but not in a good way”
Reviews.Author: Jaketjeff
Reviews.Content: Obscenely expensive throwback to the 70s(when it was last painted),it epitomises all that 's wrong with the capital's hotels. No en-suite toilet,no wifi,no native English speakers....hey,wake up to the 21st Century-it's 12 years in!

Reviews.Title: “Great little Gem”
Reviews.Author: LeeKent
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic, efficient and friendly place to stay and so near to everything. It’s within walking distance of the west end. The standard of rooms was excellent with new carpets, large rooms, spotlessly clean. The staff were ultra friendly, polite and helpful. Although some of the rooms do not have a toilet, the actual toilets are very modern and clean. The larger on suite rooms are huge. Rates are very competitive for the quality. There is no lift but that’s a minor thing. I thoroughly recommend this central location great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad you think...”
Reviews.Author: Jessica N
Reviews.Content: I was only staying here for 1 night whilst I was in London for a show. Didn't really know what to expect as my boyfriend booked the whole getaway. On arrival I was very surprised but it was a good thing. The staff were friendly and welcoming and the hotel itself was lovely and warm as it was a very cold day. My room was absolutely fine, a really good size and the very large windows let in a lot of light which was lovely. the shower was great, not dribbly and not so it was stabbing me. The shared toilets were strange but they were very clean and well maintained so it didn't feel like a problem and plus there was plenty per floor so it's not like you're sharing with a whole floor of people. The bed, if anything was too comfortable but as it was only 1 night that was fine, but overall the hotel was fine, no problems with it at all really but I'm not sure if I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and price for London - love it!”
Reviews.Author: Happydivertraveller
Reviews.Content: Finding a hotel within walking distance of the West End and Covent Garden can be an expensive exercise, unless you know of The Lancaster and its sister hotels on Bedford Place. We stayed for just one (Saturday) night and paid £150 for a double room, en suite, including a full English and continental breakfast. Other hotels were double the price. Considering this was the Saturday before Valentine's Day when lots of people visit London's restaurants, this was excellent value. We booked on the Grange Hotels website and got the best price. I received a confirmation e-mail from the hotel very quickly, answering a question I had raised on the booking. All very impressive. We booked an en-suite room and ended up in the basement in room 6. The room had a view of a backyard, but we weren't there to admire it and it really didn't bother us. Here's what we liked: location - only a 10 minute brisk walk from Covent Garden and 15 minutes from the West End theatres and London Euston station, friendly, helpful and efficient staff on Reception and the breakfast room, decor: a nice balance between traditional style and modern ameneties, cleanliness, a modern and secure room key system, reasonably sized room, comfortable and warm bed, small but very nice en-suite bathroom, traditional, snug decor in the room, choice of food at breakfast and your ability to decide whether to pay more for a cooked breakfast, or stick with the continental options, which were plentiful, and finally, being able to leave our bag before check-in and after check-out for free so we could enjoy London without trundling our luggage behind us. There was nothing we didn't like, but be warned: rooms on the front of the hotel are at the mercy of noisy lorries passing through this small street. To ensure a good night's sleep either ask for a room facing away from the street or take ear plugs and turn up the volume on your alarm clock. It was a very cold weekend and there was an icy blast through the old window frames, which you only felt if you stood right next to them. The thick curtains kept most of the chill out, but unfortunately the raidators were belting out heat right behind them! Only a minor problem though. Overall, we love this group of hotels on Bedford Place and make a bee-line for them whenever we visit the West End.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: joanne671
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just cond back from a long weekend at The Lancaster, our room was a lovely size, very clean! We had a mini bar and the prices where reasonable. The deco and the bathroom was great! Location brill, tube station a few minutes round the corner. We will definately come back to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “What a bargain!”
Reviews.Author: sarahNorwich86
Reviews.Content: For a low price hotel in central london I was very happy with this hotel. The room was large, clean and comfortable, with complimentary toiletries, magazines and a copy of the Independent outside your door each morning. Most rooms have shared toilets but they are exceptionally clean and there is a male and female toilet between 3 rooms so you aren't exactly sharing with masses of people. Breakfast was plentiful with decent coffee which is a nice change from some other hotels. The only faults I found were no free wifi and no lift, but there are only 3 floors so it is just a bit of free exercise! Overall, I had a great stay, I would definitely recommend it...brilliant location as well!

Reviews.Title: “Pretentious and overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Shanghai_Traveller1
Reviews.Content: Pretentious and very overpriced. Trust me, I wouldn’t be writing this review were it not for the fact I paid $200 a night for a hotel that promises to be MUCH more than it is. The only pros that I could come up with were that the location is decent, the rooms weren’t especially dirty, the bathrooms aren’t bad, and the staff was not unfriendly. In other words, a place I might be willing to pay $80 a night for. Other than that…..it’s an overpriced pretentious little rip-off place. 1) There is NO internet access in the rooms and NO WIFI access anywhere in the hotel. This for a hotel that claims to be suitable for the “most discerning business traveler.” But if you want to connect to the net, you do have two options. You can use the wired internet in the lobby with no privacy (and the screen facing the lobby)…..or I kid you not: you can pay the staff 10 pounds a day and they’ll connect you to the wireless access from THE HOTEL ACROSS THE STREET with some kind of secret code they have – they type it into your computer and won’t let you see what they type. Dodgy at best. Incidentally, even with this connection from the hotel across the street, it only works in the lobby also. One has to laugh reading the note from the MD in the hotel guide book that says the rooms have the “latest technology.” I guess he must mean that they do, indeed, have flush toilets because that is the only “technology” I saw that was the latest. 2) A number of rooms are in what they call the “sub-basement” which is a horrible little area below street level. Naturally, my room was there. I can’t think of anybody that would knowingly spend $200 a night for a BASEMENT room. Since the rooms at this level are generally airless and hot, you are forced to open the virtually viewless window – and therefore concurrently suffer the indignities of people looking directly down into your room – only a few feet away from the street. And since it’s so close, you also have to listen to mostly drunken conversations periodically all night long. Getting your bags to this “sub-basement” is another ordeal. Of course no lift; nobody to help with bags; and you have to navigate a very dangerous, steep, curving, and narrow set of stairs to get to that level. No handle for the first four or five stairs on the top either. Bit scary actually. 3) The rooms are tiny. I suppose about 140 square feet with absolutely NO place to put a suitcase (because there isn’t even room for a suitcase stand). Remember you’re paying about $200 (129 Pounds a night) for this - terrible value – even by London standards. Very claustrophobic – and even more so because of the view from the sub-basement. 4) There is a direct dial telephone in the room, but as you might expect, usury rates. About $6.00 for a 5 minute national call to the UK. A real rip off. 5) Breakfast is not included in the rates – or at least wasn’t in my rates. A very simple cold buffet goes for about $18 and an “English Breakfast” for about $25.00. This is not gourmet dining…..but simple, ordinary, and tired fare. Not bad food, just another rip off from this rip off hotel. You’d do much better (and get at least comparable quality food) going to even McDonalds. 6) The TV is about 20 years old (or so it seems) – maybe a 15 inch screen – 6 or 7 channels from which to choose – and in my case, a remote control that did not work. 7) The in-house hotel guide promised free newspapers (and magazines for that matter) in the rooms. Of course during the whole time I was there – none. Asked for a newspaper – and was directed to a nearby newsstand by the gal at reception. Had to laugh. Not her fault, of course. London is notorious for vastly overpriced hotels. This one is one of many. Highly suggest you find another place that isn’t so outrageous. Lots of hotels nearby that are equally lousy, but at least they aren’t as pretentious (claiming to be what they are not), and most are about 50 or 60% of the price of the Lancaster. Good example is the Tavistock about 5 min walk away. Rooms are equally dreary, but 2 big differences. First is the price is about half. Second is that price includes a pretty good all you can eat hot breakfast. Another added plus is free internet in the lobby. Its as least as good as the Lancaster – and you’ll save a lot of money.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: In_My_Opinion76
Reviews.Content: After reading some poor reviews I was a bit nervous about booking this hotel, but once I got there I was pleasantly surprised by the room, the high standard and the staff. I got there and the booking in process was simply and fast, the staff were very polite, and very helpful. I stayed in the Superior Suite, which had an on suite bathroom, and the room was immacualte. The bed was lovely and comfortable, the room was clean and it was quiet, I had one of the best nights sleep I've ever had in a hotel. So I am giving this hotel a 5 star rating, as I cannot fault it.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was absolutely disgusting, the bedspread was stained and smelt. The mattress was also stained, the blanket must of be”
Reviews.Author: Clairefuller4
Reviews.Content: I would recommend anyone stay at this hotel. The staff were extremely rude, hygiene did not exist in the hotel. I will be loading pictures of the mattress and bedding at a later date. The necessary authorities will be contacted/informed

Reviews.Title: “Not good value”
Reviews.Author: Roger L
Reviews.Content: None of the rooms on our floor of this hotel had a toilet en-suite, though we were not told this until arrival. One toilet located in the corridor was shared by 3 rooms. Despite proudly advertising its own restaurant "overlooking the garden", this was in fact located in a sister hotel a short walk away. The Lancaster only has a dining room. Breakfast very expensive at £17. 50p. NB: there are no lifts in this hotel. The room was quiet, but that's the best that could be said for it. Apart from the location, this hotel had nothing to recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Good value central London Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BristolBigRay
Reviews.Content: Great location for the West End with good sized rooms and offering good value Staff were pretty good considering the normal standards you meet in London so another plus point for this hotel Parking was very easy which again is a huge plus in this part of London and definately a serious consideration Overall a very good value hotel for business or a weekend in the capital - you could do an awful lot worse and spend an awful lot more money - if you want location and value then look no further

Reviews.Title: “Low end”
Reviews.Author: youwannabeinmyshoes
Reviews.Content: Maybe you you get what you pay for in London ? Remember this hotel is in a period building and so you get period features such as uneven floors, gaps in door furniture and if you get a room at the front be warned, the windows are old sash windows with no double glazing and you could experience the London street ALL NIGHT. It is NOT modern. We got moved to the rear of the hotel which was quiet. Staff were friendly and polite, no problem there at all. Breakfast was fair enough. But the hotel is tired and the carpets and fabrics were in need of a good clean. A review by television's "hotel inspector" would not be pretty. The first room (102) was a disgrace. Room 209 was better. It needs a simple refurbishment and I'm sure more guests would come back. If it's a girl's or boy's weekend and your not fussy then fine.You get what you pay for in London. Don't use it as a treat ! Pay an extra £50/£100 elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: RobFerrari
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in The Grange White Hall Hotel only a few weeks before, I had high hopes for my stay at the Grange Lancaster. It was only an overnight business trip, but I have to say I was highly disappointed by this hotel. Having already had to phone three times to get the correct name on my booking, I was greeted at the hotel with a room completely different to the one I had booked. Instead of getting a double room with its own en-suite, I was given a single room with no bathroom. Pretty different really, and considering the price my company had shelled out it wasn't a good start. The room was absolutely tiny, and was so hot it felt like a sauna. That was, until you opened the curtains, the windows were very drafty indeed. Nevertheless, despite being too tall for the tiny bed, I managed to get some sleep. The next drama came at breakfast, having already booked this I wandered into the breakfast room to have something to eat. "Sir, you have not booked breakfast with your room" I was greeted with, however I drew out my booking to confirm the fact I had purchased it. I was then made to stand in the corner of the room, like a convict almost, while the waiter spent 15 minutes discussing with reception whether I had paid or not. They still didn't believe me, and I was forced to sign several forms before being able to sit and eat. Honestly though, with the poor standard spread available I wish I hadn't bothered and had gone to Starbucks for a coffee instead. All things considered, I was left feeling very disappointed by this hotel, which is a shame as The Grange White Hall had left me with such a good opinion of the group. It would be a last resort before I stayed in The Grange Lancaster again.

Reviews.Title: “Central, clean, and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Denzo1
Reviews.Content: Although the exterior is modern, the lobby and staff exude the old English hotel feel. Rooms were clean and above average. Two restaurants across the street were very special. Good choice in the mid range. Close to the tube stop as well.

Reviews.Title: “I was pessimistic, but it's pretty good”
Reviews.Author: SeamusBeoirgra
Reviews.Content: I had to book a hotel at very short notice but most of the modestly priced, well reviewed places on Tripadvisor were booked out. Eventually I found a very decent rate (£70) for a single room with shower (but no toilet) at The Lancester. Firstly, it is very nicely placed in Bloomsbury very near to both Holborn and Russell Square, and therefore close to Covent Garden, as well as not too far from Kings Cross/Euston and Leicester Square. It is also a stone's throw from Russell Square and the British Museum. The central proximity had me assuming that I was going to be staying in a bit of a pit, given how much I had paid. Actually, the hotel is perfectly nice, and a great deal cleaner and welcoming than a lot of the cramped hovels around King's Cross. The room I was in was really very large - it seemed much more like a double, as did the bed, which felt more like a small double than a single. When I checked with the front desk, they confirmed that it was definitely a single. There was decent toiletries available, and a powerful hot shower in the room, plus a TV that actually worked, good tea and coffee facilities and a comfortable and very clean bed (perfect for self-pleasuring). I was unsure about the fact that I had to share a toilet, but I never saw a single soul and when I emptied my bowels on the morning of departure (which mainly consisted of the vegetable dansak I had consumed the night before on Brick Lane) I was delighted to find that the toilet itself was very nice and extremely clean. Overall, The Lancaster is a very modest hotel with no frills, but it doesn't feel like you are being ripped off and the corners being cut are reasonable for the amount charged. There are no nasty surprises, something that London tends to specialise in.

Reviews.Title: “A disaster of a hotel. I've stayed in better youth hostels. Service was the worst I have encountered for years.”
Reviews.Author: Helsbels1977
Reviews.Content: Just as I think London has started to master the art of decent hospitality (let's face it, it's taken years), I stay here. Rooms are cramped and dirty, staff are rude, tv's don't work, blankets are scratchy, nothing has been looked after or decorated for years. And all for the bargain price of £200 (!!!!!) per night. I am still in shock. Don't be fooled that this hotel is owned by the grange hotel group, this property does not come anywhere close to their usual standard.

Reviews.Title: “Best part was the Japanese Breakfast option”
Reviews.Author: geegas
Reviews.Content: Average hotel , very small rooms but it was nice to be able to break with tradition in London and enjoy a Japanese breakfast option.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay - we´ll come back!”
Reviews.Author: Trond Inge O
Reviews.Content: Nice, quiet location. Very helpful staff. Clean rooms. Comfortable beds. Very nice view from our room (ninth floor). Absolutely value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for middle of london”
Reviews.Author: Alex133
Reviews.Content: This was quite a nice hotel, myself and my partner only stayed the one night and this hotel is ideal for that on a budget. while there was no toilet in the room, the bed was large and comfortable, the room quiet and the shower was nice and powerful. the staff were friendly enough and as we only had a backpack for overnight stay, the stairs werent a problem. This is a decent hotel for an overnight stay and a reasonable price too. there were lots of places to get a full english and coffee near by and the easiest tubestation to use was holborn.

Reviews.Title: “No toilet I room”
Reviews.Author: Keiffster
Reviews.Content: Shower is plastic tray in corner of room. While u get a sink, there is no toilet. Only shared one on corridor. No air con, just a stupid fan Not a £120 hotel, more a £75, but you are in the middle of london

Reviews.Title: “lovely, friendly budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cat_buxton
Reviews.Content: stayed with my partner for our anniversary as part of a theatre break. excellent value for money, the room was beautiful and very cosy. shared bathroom but not an issue atall. breakfast wasnt special but served its purpose. you dont really expect to go to london and have lots of space without paying for it. staff seemed over worked and stressed but still friendly. also amazing location. going back next year!

Reviews.Title: “"The big mistake"”
Reviews.Author: anders202020
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel in double room with my friend. When I book it it sad that they have extra big bed. Once we come to hotel we find out that the bed is actual small for double bed. The hotel is old, and it shows. The toilet is shared with other quests. There is no internet in the rum. You can use computer at the front desk but it will cost you 5 pounds 30 min. Finally the personal is not friendly. They don´t want to help you. The night shift personal did´n even speak English. So if you are used to bed service, shared toilet it is place for you. But you can find better and cheaper hotels in London.

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: kaseyjane88
Reviews.Content: When we booked our room we didn't realize the toilet was actually shared, and down the hall. At first we were upset, but realized we weren't getting much better within our price range. As far as I could tell you only shared the very clean toilet with one or two other rooms. We never ran into anyone in the hall, and the situation was fine. Especially since we did have a sink and shower in our room. Rooms were very basic, old, but clean. Hotel staff was very nice, but young and somewhat unsure of the surrounding area. Overall, staff was great though. Having the British museum right near the hotel was great! It would take several visits to cover any portion of this museum, and since admission is free we were able to stop in whenever we had a little time to kill. There were also several tube stops, on different lines, within quick walking distance. Don't expect a high dollar, posh hotel room with great linens and plush carpeting - you are getting more than you're paying for, but this is a basic hotel. I would go back.

Reviews.Title: “1960's”
Reviews.Author: Ian40james
Reviews.Content: Only stayed one night after previously staying their other hotel the beauchamp.shared a toilet with 2 other rooms,carpet mouldy near shower,shower flow was bad.locked out of room 3 times as card didn't work and the door showed signs of been kicked in.opened window ( older sash style ) it nearly fell onto me then jammed..apart from the French guy on reception no one cared..took £20 authorisation on my card and won't be refunded for 4 days,which was policy.stayed in room 306.do not touch this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable for London!”
Reviews.Author: TevredenLeiden
Reviews.Content: OK prices for central London, great location, and helpful staff. Beds, bathrooms, rooms are clean, but basement rooms are very small and low-ceilinged.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap but horrible”
Reviews.Author: Allunen
Reviews.Content: Having booked a "standard room" online we were given a room with no toilet. Apparently this is normal for them, even though nothing of the sort was mentioned when doing the booking. The room had a shower cabinet smack in the middle of the room, so if you are sharing a room make sure it's with someone that you feel comfortable having a shower in front of. The carpet floor was rotten from all the water from the shower. I certainly wouldn't have wanted to stay there for a longer period. The location was good with Oxford Street and the British Museum a few blocks down, and there wasn't much street noise to speak of. If you decide to stay here in spite of all these facts, do steer clear of the breakfast. Walk a few hundred meters and grab a breakfast from a cafe or Subway for a couple of pounds.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: silveryblue
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two night , staff really helpful. Will defiantly be coming back. Rooms were clean and tidy with plenty of room. Perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “VERY BAD FOOD”
Reviews.Author: mrHuntingtonBeach
Reviews.Content: The only thing utterly disgusting was the food. Everyone was nice and hardworking. I have absolutley no complaints about the rooms. The location is outstanding. service is excellent. However, they should completly stay out of the food business. They should not be allowed to sell even a cookie in a sealed wrapper. They need to some how sub contract, or have delivery from outside. I love food and its important to me..Eww i can still taste the horrible food as i write this.

Reviews.Title: “Check the small print”
Reviews.Author: casamor1
Reviews.Content: I find it difficult to believe that in this day and age a hotel can charge £85 for a room without a toilet. Nowhere on the booking was this mentioned. The staff kindly offered to upgrade my room for an additional £30. I politely declined. The shared toilets were not clean, (one had a loose seat). Other than that the floor of my room was on a slope and the window did not close properly, making it quite noisy from then outside traffic. Otherwise it was OK....... Thankfully it was only for one night!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, good breakfast, clean spacious room, comfortable beds...it's all you need for a city trip”
Reviews.Author: sabrina_ide
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a 3 day city trip in London. I spent 2 nights at the Lancaster hotel in Bloomsbury. In short this is what I think of the hotel: On the down side: * we booked this hotel via our travel agent in March 2010, we specifically requested an en-suite room (so with toilet inside the room) because we had read on Tripadvisor that most rooms are only semi-suite. I do not like to wander the corridors at night in my PJ's. Upon check-in we learned there was no en-suite room available. We could check-in The Clarendon across the street (same hotel chain), but there would be an extra charge. We of course refused, it was booked half a year ago and confirmed by our travel agent! The receptionist asked us to wait in the lobby while she called the head of reservations. Through all this the receptionist was very polite and professional. 5 Minutes later she told us everything was fine, we could have an en-suite room in the Lancaster. * there were only 2 sockets in the room, both in use. So when we wanted to charge our cell phones and cameras we had the pull out the wires. This is just a minor detail!!! But it might be interesting to know if you're carrying a lot of electrical equipment that needs charging. On the plus side: * so eventually we got our en-suite room. It turned out to be a triple room on the lower ground level, located at the end of a corridor, no other rooms in that corridor, so we were very private. The room and bathroom were huge! We were only 2 persons, so we had all the room we needed. We had two seperate beds, a sofa, a writing table, a normal table, a tv, a wardrobe, a smaller closet and a table to put our luggage on. Since we were on lower ground level we had no view, we were looking at a wall, but we were only in our room in the morning and in the evening. The shower was in the bath tub. The beds were soft and comfortable. Room temperature was a bit chilly but that's just what we like. For your info: it was room 008. * baggage can be left at reception * every morning The Independant was delivered. The hotel staff put it in front of our door. Very attentive. * Staff was very friendly, helpful and professional. Even during our check-in, when we were surprised not the have been allocated an en-suite room, the receptionist handled the situation in a professional manner. On our second day (in the morning) we wanted to check the weather forecast (the previous day there was a printed sheet on the reception desk with the forecast). The sheet wasn't there, the receptionist immediately printed the forecast for us. Also on our second day (in the evening) we had to use the internet in the lobby (£ 3 for 15 minutes), because we needed to check the Eurostar website, there was a strike in Belgium. We only used the computer for 3 minutes and when we wanted to pay the receptionist told us we needn't pay because it was so short. Twice we ordered a cab. It took less than 2 minutes before the cab arrived and the concierge escorted us from the lobby to the taxi, holding open all of the doors and carrying our luggage. * Breakfast was superb. There was a certificate on the wall saying that the hotel won the Breakfast Award in 2009. It was continental buffet breakfast, but you could also order English breakfast if you wanted. Within 1 minute there was someone standing at our table asking if we wanted to drink something warm (tea, coffee or chocolate milk) and if we wanted toast. Another minute later our order was delivered to our table. The buffet itself consisted had croissants, sandwiches and several other pastries. All kinds of jam, 4 kinds of cornflakes, milk, fruit juice, water, a lot of fruit, cheese and ham. An ideal way to start your day. I didn't need food until 2 pm after having had breakfast in The Lancaster! * Good location! We walked from St. Pancras to our hotel, a good 15 to 20 minutes walking. Most of the time we used the tube system of course. The tube station is Russell Square, 10 minutes walking from the hotel. The Lancaster is located in a quiet street between two parks. Several other Grange hotels are located in that street. So overall: - friendly, professional, helpful and attentive staff - good location - spacious and clean room with comfortable beds - superb breakfast I would definitely stay in this hotel, and recommend it to other people. I hope my review might be useful. Don't hesitate to contact me if you'd like to have more information!

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable value semi-ensuite; nothing fancy, but good location.”
Reviews.Author: AndrewS60
Reviews.Content: Visited this hotel several times over the last year, primarily because of the location and also because it offers good value semi-ensuite rooms. This means a washbasin and shower cubicle in the room, but toilets shared (two toilets for every three or four bedrooms just a few steps from the rooms). Full ensuite avaiable at higher price. Beds comfortable, doubles are reasonable size, no aircon, no lifts and some rooms are on third floor - a bit of a treck up the stairs. Reasonable cleanliness, but some carpets in public areas could do with replacing. Don't bother with the hotel breakfast, go to a local coffee shop, much better value! Staff pleasant enough (note that they charge you for your room on arrival, slightly unusual). Great location very near British Museum and a short walk to Covent Garden and theatre-land. The hotel is the cheapest in the Grange Hotel portfolio in London: a bonus is that you can use the swimming pool and fitness centre in the nearby Grange hotel in Holborn for a modest extra charge.

Reviews.Title: “We went for value and were delighted to get the lot .....”
Reviews.Author: Maree_Auckland_1051
Reviews.Content: Our room was very spacious indeed, very clean and well appointed (gorgoeous drapes) We were a little sceptical about not having a toilet in our room however as it turned out this was not a problem whatsoever. Just along the hallway were two very clean and comfortable toilets, stylishly decorated in black glossy tiles and during our stay we never encountered any other guests using these facilites. The breakfast that was included in our price was excellent. Every single staff member we had contact with had the highest of standards - you could see that they all worked together as a team and had a pride in their hotel - each of them, from the dining room staff through to the front of house staff - they were all equally friendly and helpful. Russell Sq is a great location as it's so central and especially good being on the Piccadilly line directly to and from Heathrow. We will be choosing to stay at The Lancaster again and will be recommending it to family and friends. Excellent Value.

Reviews.Title: “Dilapidated and neglected but good location.”
Reviews.Author: bhom
Reviews.Content: Endured three nights in this hotel which is part of a group with four in the same street.A glorified B&B without any redeeming features except for location.Dreadful dining room with breakfast at £17 was a joke.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed and wont stay here again - check before you book your room is ensuite.”
Reviews.Author: 183harri
Reviews.Content: Talk about being disappointed. We chose this hotel for its great location as we were at a gig in somerset house - almost walking distance - and had stayed in a hotel close by before. Things did not get off to a good start when having booked for an ensuite, we were informed that the hotel only booked standard rooms(when booked via expedia) which were not ensuite,. This was not made clear on the booking. So we had to spend another £90 to upgrade and then were offered breakfast for £17 each- given there are a host of other places to have a great breakfast for half the price - we decided to give this a miss. The room was tiny as was the bathroom although perfectly serviceable. Having asked the hotel to give us confirmation three times to go back to our booking agent and being told they would do this, we finally left the hotel at 4pm still without the confirmation. Given all of this hassle, and the fact the room was soo small, and not airconditioned - the temp in london was over 30degrees when we visited - I will not be staying either in this hotel, or any within their group- having stayed in another before and had a similiar difficult time.

Reviews.Title: “Little niggles”
Reviews.Author: Tigs2
Reviews.Content: This could be the perfect reasonable hotel in London except for the small things. The location is great, the staff are lovely and the rooms are bigger and more comfortable than other London hotels in the same price bracket Ive stayed in. It has the same rundown, worn common areas with uneven floors that most London hotels in this price range have but I guess you dont spend much time in the corridors. Furnishing in the rooms is cheap but looks fine. But there are some small things that over a few days became annoying. Lack of wi-fi is the main one. I was travelling for business so it was particularly irritating but surely most people travelling nowadays need access to the internet to check flights, details, schedules, etc. There was one common computer downstairs but it was usually busy. I thought almost all hotels, even cheap ones, now had wi-fi? Its an easy thing to fix but I would not stay here again unless it was available. Also, the rooms were far too warm. Temperature in London was very high but there seemed to be heat coming from the floor below and one of the windows would not stay open properly so it was very hard to keep the room cool at night. Air con might be expensive but even some in room fans would be helpful when its that warm. So overall, a good hotel (by London standards) but not a great one - but if it had wi-fi, I would certainly stay here again outside of the summer.

Reviews.Title: “3* Central London - Ideal!”
Reviews.Author: littlemisstraveller5
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Lancaster in Bloomsbury on 23rd-25th June. The location was perfect for what we were using it for – a gig in Camden and generalised tourist wandering. The hotel is in close proximately to Tottenham Court Road, Holborn and Russell Square tube stations and there are plenty of buses that pass in and around the area. There are so many amenities and tourist attractions within walking distance including banks, mini supermarkets, bars, restaurants and the fantastic British Museum. Once arriving at the hotel, the hotel reception staff were pleasant and efficient. We were given the general hotel policies and were offered help with baggage. We’re used to stairs in our apartment building so it didn’t bother us that there wasn’t a lift service (that we could see). We received wake up calls and The Independent newspaper was delivered daily, which was a treat whilst drinking your morning cup of tea. The room itself was quite large by London standards. Our room was a Semi-Ensuite, which as you probably already know by now is a shower and wash basin in your room and shared toilet facilities outside. Don’t let this put you off though, we never had to wait for the toilet facilities and it was cleaned and replenished as required. We had room number 105, which was on the first floor and facing the road. The room had two very large windows, which opened completely, which in hind side we were totally grateful for. Expect a little noise during delivery hours in this room– you are in London, not in the middle of the countryside. The weather was glorious on the days we were staying in London and the hotel unfortunately doesn’t have any air conditioning. The room was absolutely stifling on occasions. However, the windows came into use and there was a small desk fan in the wardrobe that you were able to use. The general décor of the room was quite bog standard for England. The room could benefit for some slight renovations or aesthetic amendments for example, the sheet on the bed had seen better days, the wardrobe door never closed properly and the TV channel opportunities wouldn’t really suit the foreign travellers who want to keep up with general affairs. However this is a three star hotel; there were opportunities in the Grange Hotel range to be upgraded to a higher star hotel in the same area. We paid £188 for two nights (inc. VAT/Room Only) and were quite pleasantly surprised. The only downside to the room itself was that the shower and wash basin area could probably benefit from tiling. Around the shower area the carpet was starting to smell musty and was looking worn from the water damage. We used one of the towels provided as a ‘bath mat’, which grated on me for all of about 5 seconds. The room was cleaned down daily and replenished with towels and tea & coffee items. We requested ironing facilities during our stay, which was awaiting use on our arrival. There was also a welcome pack including maps and general hotel/London information which came in handy whilst figuring out what tourist attractions we wanted to visit. We never tried breakfast/room service facilities; there are just so many restaurant and bar options in and around Central London. I believe the hotel were offering breakfast at £17.50 for full English and £15.50 for Continental if you have booked at a RO basis. We also never tried the hotels laundry, driver or internet facilities, so I couldn’t comment. However I did see the one computer in the main lounge area which could be used for e-mails etc (at a fee I suspect). All in all – I would go back to one of the Grange Hotels. We enjoyed our stay at the hotel! For what we paid in the location, I'm really pleased we chose to stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Ok for the price, but could be improved”
Reviews.Author: erg1985
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night in June 2010, had a basement room - very large room, especially for London. The problem with being in the basement, soon became clear, as due to the proximity to the underground, every 2-3 minutes you could hear the train go past, and the mirror on the wall shake. Also the specific room I had, was next door to the staff room, so there were coming and goings all day. Bathroom was not particulary clean, which was slightly disappointing. It is worth noting that many of the rooms are not ensuite, so is worth checking this before booking a room. Also worth noting if you are a business traveller - there is no wifi in the hotel. Breakfast was basic but ok.

Reviews.Title: “dirty”
Reviews.Author: travelerfromsocal9
Reviews.Content: I knew going in that this hotel was not going to be anywhere near the Four Seasons, but I didn't think that it would be this bad. First off, I found a period stain on one of the bankets on the bed. DISGUSTING! I had them change it the next day, which I think they did. (I checked for the stain and couldn't find it.) They don't change the towels for you unless you ask them to. I'm not sure about other rooms, but generally, in most rooms, there is only a shower and sink. You use shared toilets on the floor. There are no elevators, and so going up and down the stairs with your luggage could be a drag. There is not AC. Location is decent though, about a 5-10 min walk from the Russell Square tube station, and less than 5 minutes away from the British Museum. One thing that upset me the most was that we had asked them to call us a cab on the day that we were leaving and they called a gypsy cab instead of a regular certified cab. This gypsy cab driver totally took advantage of us (we couldn't change our service because the hotel had already put it on our tab.) All in all, not all that great of an experience. I would have (and should have) paid more to go to a better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “wonderfull place, beautifull location”
Reviews.Author: audreyMex
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay very much. The staff was very friendly and professional, without being too much. We felt as being at home. The room was a little dated but absolutely comfortable. I slept like a baby. Beeing almost in the heart of London, it took only one stop by tube, we could travel easy all over London. I can recommend this Hotel, even to spoiled guests who like good food.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy, not very clean but good location”
Reviews.Author: Dannyxxx
Reviews.Content: Very nice location, good staff at the reception, big rooms. Now, when this is said, there are some thing that were not so good. We stayed at "executive room", and it was disappointing. Bedding was not very clean. Stains on the blankets, hair on the sheets. . . Carpet was smelly; curtains were VERY dirty and dusty. We had room nr. 7 and it was in the basement, just next to the storage room, so from 7 o'clock in the morning, cleaning staff was making noise, which made it impossible for us to sleep. We changed room, and got nr. 8. Room was also in the basement, under the dining room (you could hear every step made upstairs), plus just opposite of the room there was a changing room for the staff, and from early in the morning they start talking, even sitting on the stairs in front of the room, which created a feeling of sleeping at the market place. There is no WiFi in the hotel, and you have to pay a lot to use their internet. Food for the breakfast is very poor - with sweaty cheese, curled ham and coffee that is only good as a laxative. Pity that the hotel is so run down. However, at least bathrooms are very clean.

Reviews.Title: “A really enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: JohnL43
Reviews.Content: We go to London quite a lot these days and stay in a variety of 4 star hotels. This was the best one we have stayed in. Really well furnished, excellent service and nice friendly staff. The location, just behind the tube was really good. We will definately return and maybe try the Thai restaurant next time.

Reviews.Title: “trip to the loo”
Reviews.Author: jenandpete
Reviews.Content: A nice place to stay,but we should have read the facilities list and not made the presumption that All hotels Nowadays are en-suite. Friendly staff, who tried to help although didnt always know the answer. Would we stay again. if the room was ensuite, then yes

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice ....”
Reviews.Author: Richard765
Reviews.Content: As I am sure you know by now this hotel does not have en suite facilities (although it does have shower and wash basin in the rooms). If you need en suite then this is not the hotel for you, they don’t claim to have them they don’t try a deceive you, it is what it is. What it is is a charming clean friendly well located hotel. Clean comfortable rooms, the beds and well made and the staff are friendly. The location is excellent it has everything you would want in a central London hotel except en suite .... I recommend it and would stay again. One bad thing .... at just short of £20.00 for breakfast .... I recommend you eat out; there are any number of delightful cafes serving everything from fresh fruit, muffins and coffee to full English with builder’s tea within a few minutes’ walk of the hotel. Try ‘Eataly’ on Kingsway .... 5 minutes walk, just past Holborn Tube ..... excellent quality and value!

Reviews.Title: “The Most Fab Hotel We Have Stayed In”
Reviews.Author: beaubeau_10
Reviews.Content: The Royal Lancaster Hotel, Hyde Park, London was absolutely outstanding. It was my birhtday so we were upgraded from a deluxe room to the Royal Park Suite, had a bithday cake, balloons and invited to afternoon tea. The service and staff were all excellent, I honestly felt special that weekend. We enjoyed ourselves so much I have just booked to stay again in the summer for my husbands birthday. If you would like to treat yourselves then i would definately recommend THE ROYAL LANCASTER HOTEL 10/10...

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING location, great staff, will definitely go back”
Reviews.Author: BeckyColley
Reviews.Content: I was a bit worried about not having a toilet in the bedroom but being on a budget thought "it'll do" - it really wasn't a problem at all. The toilet was literally 15 seconds away, and was always spotless and fully stocked with loo roll! The room itself was really big and comfortable. The only problem was it was a bit chilly. It was snowing in London but even with the heating on full it took ages to heat up (literally a couple of hours!!). Aside from that I loved this hotel and will definitely return. The location is unbeatable and the staff were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Pleased I followed the recommendations”
Reviews.Author: kiwisteveandali
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a decent hotel, centrally located and at a reasonable price. The Lancaster fitted all our requirements and more. It is clean and while the rooms could be more spacious we were out most of the time and this is London after all. The service was great and the location fantastic being 50m from the entrance to Hyde park and 30m from Lancaster Gate underground. Paddington train station was less than 10 minutes walking. Also Oxford St was a 10 minute walk away. We found nice places to eat between the hotel and Paddington station. Overall we were very impressed and would definately go abck there.

Reviews.Title: “£100 a night and no toilet in the room”
Reviews.Author: EfmManchester
Reviews.Content: When I booked I presumed that there would be an ensuite bathroom. There was a shower in the corner of the room and a sink but the toilet was across the landing - rubbish. No lift. Pillows were rock hard as well. For the price I would much prefer to stay in a travel lodge type hotel where at least you can be sure of what you are getting.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean room and outstanding value”
Reviews.Author: uctmd77
Reviews.Content: We found this quaint little place near The British Museum, located on a very quiet street midway between the beautifully tranquil Russell Square and Bloomsbury Square (neither one more than 100 yards from the front door). Location in Bloomsbury is outstanding, a few blocks from the Russell Square underground (Piccadilly line, direct underground to/from Heathrow). The hotel has no elevator and tight stairs, but we managed easily. Shower in our room was adequate, toilet was shared by a few rooms, but was always spotless and available. Room is small but adequate (we were there only to sleep). No air conditioning, but they do provide a fan and in-room coffee/tea. Continental breakfasts were ample and quite good. Front desk staff very polite, efficient and helpful. Certainly lacking some of the amenities one might expect of a luxury hotel (such as high speed wireless internet ), but cannot beat the value. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, helpful staff - enjoyed the stay!”
Reviews.Author: JMUBelle
Reviews.Content: They did not have any garden rooms available, but my sister and I were given a first floor (one level above street) street-facing room. We did not have an issue with street noise beyond normal city sounds. There were one men's and one women's toilet for sharing by about three rooms - I never saw anyone else coming or going from those closest to our room, and they were always clean. The room was a bit more spacious than I expected, with a lovely little coffee/tea service station. The staff was extremely accommodating (they even found us a complimentary mending kit at a sister hotel and brought it over!) and there were no hidden charges upon check out. Internet was expensive (and not wifi), so we went without that. Though the weather in London was pretty perfect (just around 70F most days, I think), the room did get very warm the first day/night. THEN we figured out how to open the huge windows, and did so each time we returned to the room, and the temperature was fine for the rest of the trip. Overall, the Lancaster was a great deal in a great location, and I would stay there again. Really perfect location, two blocks over from busy Bloomsbury St, and an easy walk into the heart of the West End.

Reviews.Title: “Are they having cash flow problems?”
Reviews.Author: Wafdof
Reviews.Content: I was treated as if I were a flight risk. On check-in, credit card was run and closed out for full 4-day stay. Asked about local calls. Staff could not tell me estimated charges and recommended I buy a phone card. Tried to call with phone card, but room phone was "blocked." Was asked to pay 20 Pound deposit up front to unblock phone. Was asked to pay for breakfast in advance. "Recently remodeled," but no Internet. No lifts. Rooms were nicely equipped, but stuffy and overheated - no fans or ventilation system. provided.. Good breakfast and convenient to Underground.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: droptopcar
Reviews.Content: From the doorman to reception, restaurant and housekeeping the staff were extremely friendly and effiicient. Breakfast was excellent and attention to detail was paramount. Couldn't fault. Look forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny dated bedrooms”
Reviews.Author: Clymping
Reviews.Content: Great on-site parking, check-in fine. Hotel bedrooms are very dated and rather bland in decor can't even say minimalistic - just bland. Bathrooms exceptionally tiny and very dated. Waited a long time for an elevator they could do with more.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent budget accomodation- my new London crash pad”
Reviews.Author: NellsterH
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on a Friday night , using it as a crash pad after a night out. The hotel was the cheapest I found and at £45 for a single and continental breakfast ,I thought it was a bargain (booked on hotel website for cheapest rate) and was dubious as to what I'd find. I was aware that there was no toilet in the room and I hoped that this the only reason the the room was so cheap. The staff were polite, the room spotless and in good order with plenty towels, hairdryer and toiletries and even magazines to read. The toilet facilities were immaculate and there were plenty available for use. The continental breakfast was excellent with good quality produce and endless hot toast and tea. Also as a single female resident I felt very safe in the intimate surroundings. I will definitely use this hotel again and don't be put off by toilets not being in some of the rooms it really isn't a problem!

Reviews.Title: “Great Find”
Reviews.Author: MaccaDali
Reviews.Content: For the price paid, it was perfect. Located in a very nice quiet location near Russell Square, with only a short 5-10 min walk into SoHo. On arrival, the staff were very friendly and helpful. We did have to drag our bags up the stairs, but it's not THAT MUCH of a problem, really. The room was very comfortable and quiet, with a nice leafy view of a rear courtyard and garden. The fact that there was no toilet in the actual room was not a problem either, as it was only one door down the hallway, and you can't hear anyone go there anyway. We paid around 60 pounds total per night $120 AUD, for a central, clean, quiet, and friendly hotel. You can't get much better than that in London. Will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “recommended, but book what you require.”
Reviews.Author: mesrine
Reviews.Content: really pleased with our stay. we were on a budget, and booked a cheap room, with shared toilet. but on arrival, we were given room 2 , one of their best rooms. large clean well appointed room, overlooking garden, with bath shower and toilet...the hotel is in good order and very well placed to walk to all of central london sites. v nice hotel, but make sure you realise some rooms have shared toilets.....

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, wonderful location ... with a few buts ...”
Reviews.Author: ArianaUP
Reviews.Content: I have booked three nights at the hotel for my weekend in London. I booked before I read the reviews just because the location and rates were wonderful. I arrived at the hotel at noon and check in was fast and simple. My room was number 5 in the lower ground floor and was quite issolated from all the other rooms. There are no elevators in this hotel so I had to drag my suitcase down the stairs but it wasn't that bad. Having booked the hotel prior to reading the reviews I was ready for the fact the loo was outside the room but to my surprise I got a room with both shower and bath and a loo :) The room was big and spacious with a queen size bed, TV, work area, there was a ventilator, ironing board and coffee/tea making facilities. It was a great treat for a solo budget traveler and the location made it even more wonderful ! Althought in general everything was great , there are two spoilers that bothered me a bit . The first one was the strange noise I kept hearing which I figured out to be the noise of the tube on the Piccadily line that apparently passes right under the hotel :) but still it wasn't that bad as I didn't spend the day in the room and I was so tired at night that it didn't really bother my sleep. The one thing that did annoy me more than that was the fact that the hotel doesn't have a luggage room. This was especially annoying since my flight back was at 22:30 and the hotel staff weren't really keen on helping me , they could only appologise and say it was "company policy" so I found myself dragging my bags to Euston station (in case you would like to use this option it costs 6.5 Pounds per bag). In general I really liked my stay, since I'm a budget traveler this room was very good in comparison with other hotels I've stayed in around London even with the two small "surprises" I've mentioned before.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful Location!”
Reviews.Author: aedrago
Reviews.Content: When my boyfriend and I arrived at the hotel, we already knew that there were no toilets in the rooms. It was directly down the hall and we NEVER had to wait to use it. The shower was a little weird and there is very little privacy. Traveling with anyone else would make for an ackward situation. The location is absolutely wonderful as it is right by the Russell Square Tube station and not far from Holburn tube station. When traveling here however, make sure you give the taxi driver the address for there are TWO Lancaster Hotels in London. He took us to the Royal Lancaster first and then to our hotel. Just make sure you're clear! The staff were friendly though not very knowledgable of "tourist" activities. They have brochures in the lobby of London tours and things but you have to call to book yourself and they charge your for the local phone call. There are no lifts and we had to haul our luggage up only 1 flight of stairs and there was no bell-boy. There is no available internet but WiFi cafes all over nearby. Take advantage of the breakfast too! It was a great value and very good. We did not travel to London to hang out all day in our hotel room. The time we did spend there was quite pleasant. We would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: richnindy
Reviews.Content: Noting the comments on this website, we booked an en suite room, which DOES have a toilet in the room. It was also in the back, overlooking the garden, and was extremely quiet and comfortable. The room is a very good size, as is the bathroom, and clean. The location really cannot be beat: halfway between the Holborn and Russell Square stations, 10 minute walk to Covent Garden, 10 minute walk to Soho, right next to the British Museum. We were very pleased with this hotel and would most definitely stay here on a return trip to London.

Reviews.Title: “Disgraceful”
Reviews.Author: Emissary
Reviews.Content: Arrived at The Lancaster yesterday evening. Waited 10 minutes while the (lone) receptionist dealt with another guest, only to discover that the hotel had "inadvertently" cancelled my booking, and now had no rooms available. Waited another 15 minutes while they sorted out another room at their sister hotel, The Grange Strathmore. Supposedly 15 minutes away, their driver took an hour to find it, and when I got there the place was frankly a dump. I'd never use either hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “My new hotel in London”
Reviews.Author: BruceRoney
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice property. Yes, the toilets are down the hall but then I saved a LOT of money - every comparable property with a toilet in the room was at least 30% more expensive. There was shower and sink and so it was not that often I had to leave the room to use the facilities. The staff were friendly and very helpful, the breakfast above average and the location AMAZING. This is my new hotel in London.

Reviews.Title: “Good for couples”
Reviews.Content: Definately great location for travellers using the tube. At first got a shock as we had heavy luggages and there was no lift... but the concierge carried our suitcases up 3 floors! D room was big and very clean. Its true no toilet in the room but 1 loo is shared between 3 rooms and it was always very clean. We never encountered anyone using the loo. The area is not noisy so we had a good night sleep. The breakfast is also suffiecient and the staff were always friendly. I would definately use this budget hotel again when I am in London.

HotelInfo.Name: The Lancaster
HotelInfo.Address: 4-6 Bedford Place, London WC1B 5JD, England
